There's still nearly 2 hours of material left from that taping; In fact there's a report from that taping, Let me go and seek it!
What's still left:
* Weird Newscasters * Let's Make A Date * Duet (A second one!) * Greatest Hits (with Robin and Wayne singing!) * Three Headed Broadway Star (Wayne/Robin/Ryan) * Hats/Dating Service Video * Questionable Impressions * Action Replay * Newsflash (Colin and Ryan anchor, Robin in the field) * Film TV and Theatre Styles (Colin/Ryan/Robin) * Motown Group (Wayne/Robin/Ryan) * Three Headed Broadway Star (Robin/Drew/Ryan) * Foreign Film Dub (Robin/Drew/Colin/Ryan) * Hoedown (Rumored) * World's Worst (Robin/Drew/Colin/Ryan)
We're fine. As long as the full ratings are up we're fine

WRITING.TITLE: Whose Line game goes to hysterics (THE CAT!)

WRITING.TEXT:
Smart Question! I love it! Here's what I would do!
*Let Living Scenery sit on the back burner for a while; Have that and both Helping Hands be a little less frequent.
*Have them play Let's Make a Date; The guest is the contestant, The other four have the quirks; Possibly try that out for Party Quirks (Guest is the host;Other four, etc etc)
*Singing Guests; No more Song Styles/Duet to them. Let them sing w/Wayne or Wayne/Singer Fourth seater to an audience member. Song Styles becoming Duet (Wayne/Guest) and Duet becoming Trio (Wayne/Fourth/Guest); Perhaps one occasion the special guest joins Wayne or Wayne/Fourth in Greatest Hits.
*Little more frequent on Three Headed Broadway Star; Either Wayne/Fourth/Colin to Guest or Fourth/Guest/Ryan to Audience Member.
*On rare occasions switch it up on Sound Effects; Both one audience member and the special guest provide the Sound Effects. (Imagine if they got Michael Winslow and he played the game!!)
*Daytime Talk Show (Take a look at the Jerry Springer playing!)
*Questions; We saw it with Cedric yes, but why not have all five do it (All Four + Guests)
*Scenes From a Hat; On a few occasions perhaps we should see them with the other four, trying the game.

WRITING.TITLE: Willie Robertson to be on "Whose Line is it Anyway?"

WRITING.TEXT: I could say what just came to mind, but I won't hahahaha. Long Story short, I don't see it lasting long, Both that and The Messengers don't do well on Friday's (Resulting in Cedric being Pulled and Messengers getting cancelled); Also looks like Whose Line survives the Friday line up again; It'll be switched to Monday's in July and a New Season is expected in 2016.

It's actually pretty good now, Season 11 is kicking butt and Aisha has come into her own
Yeah it was pulled from the Friday line up, It'll come back June 29th to a Late time slot on Mondays. The show itself is quite lame!
His smile was soooo big!
That was so cute! Looked like Wayne made his night!
That was cute; and they put it at 8PM because they pulled Cedric's show.
CW Version is awesome!
Whose Line never really runs from late year into new year anyway. Pretty sure it means Season 12 has been confirmed
Sounds like it means we've got another season coming

WRITING.TEXT: Go rewatch some of the SFAH from the Season 4 and Season 5 episodes. Usually varied from 3 to 5 scenes. and we're usually getting 3 to at least 5 scenes. and If you have been tuning into this Season, we've actually been getting much different scenes.
Instead of whining about missing and wanting certain people on the show, let's just think of ways we can help bring viewship up.
You're right and yet all these butthurt Drew lovers down voted the comment.

CW's doing something, They're repeating Cedric's episode on 5/22 instead of a new ep. We've got till July, before they change Whose Line's day to Monday. Perhaps the change to Monday should happen sooner?
What can WE (and yes I'm saying, WE) do to help the ratings? Chime in, Give us some ideas!

That's no reason to not watch it; It's just as good without Drew. This is the thing that kills me. It doesn't matter who hosts it! If we're getting the improv we know and love, the games we know and love. Why should who's hosting matter? We've got the same cast performing for us! It worked with Clive, It worked with Drew, and It works with Aisha!!

WRITING.TITLE: Jane the Virgin's - Jamie Camil to be on "Whose Line is it Anyway?" (5/8)

WRITING.TEXT: Its a crappy time slot, and actually its the entire CW Network Friday line up. Even Cedric and the Messengers aren't doing well! I'm trying everything to promote the show, TheCW should be too. (Btw last week hurt the ratings due to baseball preempting it)
Agreed! Hasn't been done since the 1999 tapings!

On the two complaints, we're pretty early into the Season. The editor is bound to edit more points giving away into the show. Aisha gives away a load of points during the tapings, nearly after every game; It's just what the editor decides to keep in. Same goes for Credit Readings, Think its a third time the editor put in an all four credit reading. (And they do at least 4-5 each taping!) Same also goes to the audience suggestion and participation games, It's what the editor does (They're choosing out of 18-22 played games; though the editor could make a load of better choices!)
Questions is fantastic! and the last song in Greatest Hits was quite creative!

I thought this ep had more variety. Questions I liked seeing 3 times in a row, Its a lot better than just seeing it once in Season's 10 and 11. If it becomes 4-5 times in a row, then yeah, It'll become tiring.
